intro: Cheiranthus muricatus, commonly known as the rough wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Its flowers are usually bright yellow or orange, with a rough, hairy texture on the stems and leaves. It blooms from late winter to early spring, making it one of the earliest flowering plants in its native range.
